column1: West Covina is a city in Los Angeles County
column3: located 19 miles (31 km) east of Downtown Los Angeles in the eastern San Gabriel Valley and is part of Greater Los Angeles. The population for the city was 106

column1: West Covina is bordered by Covina to its north and east side. Baldwin Park is to the west
== History ==
West Covina was incorporated as an independent city in 1923 to prevent the city of Covina from building a sewage farm in the area. Benjamin Franklin Maxson
column3: (1897-1928) initiated the incorporation process and was the first mayor.  Walnut groves and orange groves continued to flourish. The population in 1930 was 769 and blossomed to 1
column4: 549 in 1940. As a result of remarkable expansion during the post World War II building boom
column5: West Covina became one of the fastest-growing U.S. cities between 1950 and 1960
column9: 000 citizens. The decades between 1960 and 2000 demonstrated steady growth
column10: which slowed significantly by the time of the 2010 census.

column1: The City of West Covina began the second half of the 20th century with new developments and projects
column2: mostly brought on by big business. The City Hall and police facility were built in 1969 as the first phase of an example of a Joint Powers Authority in the County of Los Angeles. The Civic Center Joint Powers Authority
column3: consisting of the County of Los Angeles and the City of West Covina
column4: also completed a three-level parking structure in the Civic Center complex. The Civic Center complex includes the Los Angeles County Regional Library and the Citrus Municipal Court building and the city offices.

column1: The first Redevelopment Agency project included a regional shopping center
column3: with three major department stores and 150 shops in an air-conditioned
column4: enclosed mall. It also included the revitalization of the older sections of the shopping center. The Fashion Plaza has provided the citizens of the San Gabriel Valley with convenient access to all shopping needs. In 1991 the mall was renovated adding a food court and additional shops
column5: as well as the redecorating of the entire mall. The mall was renamed "The Plaza at West Covina". The Plaza opened a new 100
column7: 300 m2). wing in October 1993 featuring 50 new stores including a new Robinson's-May and interior renovation throughout The Plaza.

column1: The Redevelopment Agency's efforts have also resulted in several major office buildings in the city
column3: in addition to two new community shopping centers

column1: == Geography ==
=== Climate ===
The San Gabriel Valley region has a hot-summer Mediterranean climate
== New and current projects ==
=== West Covina Sportsplex Project (Phase 2) ===
A project that is completed is the West Covina Sportsplex Project. It is made up of four components
column5: and a commercial office development (Phase 2). The 43-acre (170
column6: 000 m2) site commercial development has over 300
column8: 000 m2) of new high quality commercial retail space. The commercial area includes a Target
column11: PetSmart and various other specialty shops and restaurants. Big League Dreams Sports Park features batting cages
column12: a multi-use pavilion that can be used as a soccer field
column14: and can be rented out as a hall. It also has 6 high quality ball fields that replicate sporting landmarks like Yankee Stadium
column18: Dodger Stadium and Angel Stadium of Anaheim. The Big League Dreams Sports Park is a city park. It is owned by the city and maintained and operated under contract by Big League Dreams. Phase 2
column19: the 18-hole championship golf course and Corporate office buildings are both currently in the entitlement stage of development.

column1: === Westfield West Covina expansion ===
The expansion to Plaza West Covina has been completed. It now has both cosmetic and structural renovation and expansion to the inside and outside of the mall that includes a new 45
column5: 363 added square feet of restaurant and retail space

column1: == Politics ==
In the California State Legislature
column2: West Covina is split between the  22nd Senate District
column5: represented by Republican Ling Ling Chang. In the California State Assembly
column6: it is split between the  48th Assembly District
column9: represented by Republican Phillip Chen. In the United States House of Representatives
column10: West Covina is in California's  32nd congressional district

column1: February 2011 voter registration statistics from the Secretary of State showed that 47% of voters in the city were registered Democrats and 28% Republicans.  West Covina was once a Republican stronghold
column2: but today favors the Democratic Party
column3: in part because of demographic changes in its population.

column1: == Government and infrastructure ==
The Los Angeles County Department of Health Services operates the Pomona Health Center in Pomona
== Education ==
=== Primary and secondary schools ===
==== Public schools ====
West Covina is mostly served by the West Covina Unified School District
column6: one continuation high school (Coronado Alt. High); and one adult school.

column1: Some portions of West Covina are also served by the Covina Valley Unified School District and Rowland Unified School District. Half of the residents of the affluent South Hills neighborhood of West Covina have the option of choosing either West Covina Unified School District (WCUSD) or Covina Valley Unified School District (CVUSD).
South Hills High School
column3: and Mesa Elementary School are within the city limits of West Covina

column1: Edgewood High School was originally opened in 1960.  The first class to attend all four years at EHS graduated in 1964.  EHS was later converted to a recreational park per se.  EHS was newly opened and as of December 2011 International Baccalaureate accredited high school in West Covina Unified School District. It is located on the NE side of the Edgewood Middle School campus. 2010–2011 is the first opened year of EHS and is continuing on building forward.
Residents of the Woodside Village neighborhood are covered by Rowland Unified School District. These schools include: Nogales High School
West Covina High School was founded in 1956 and South Hills High School was founded in 1964.
International Polytechnic High School (I-Poly)
column2: a public school located at California State Polytechnic University
column4: is also available to high school students who go through an application process.

column1: === Universities and colleges ===

There are several colleges and universities within a few miles of the city limits including Azusa Pacific University; Citrus College; Mt. San Antonio College; Pasadena City College; Whittier College; University of the West; and California State Polytechnic University at Pomona.
== Health care ==
=== Citrus Valley Medical Center – Queen of The Valley Campus ===

West Covina has many health care facilities including the main hospital Citrus Valley Medical Center – Queen of the Valley Campus also known as Queen of The Valley Medical Center. Citrus Valley Medical Center – Queen of the Valley Campus is a comprehensive
column3: well known for its Family Birth & Newborn Center
column4: with more deliveries than any other health care facility in the East San Gabriel Valley. The Level II Neonatal Intensive Care Unit has cared for more than 15
column5: 000 babies since opening in 1972. The Queen's Mammography Center provides low cost mammography screening and breast health education. "Queen of the Valley Campus" Emergency Department is one of the busiest in Southern California
column7: 000 visits annually. Other services include an 18-bed Pediatrics Unit
column10: and MRI and CAT-scan machines. Queen of the Valley Hospital
column12: was built on the site that formally was Sunset Elementary School.

column1: === Other medical facilities in West Covina ===

There are many other private medical practices and clinics that serve the city of West Covina. Kaiser Permanente operates both the West Covina Medical Offices and West Covina Behavioral Health Offices. East Valley Community Health Center is a large
column3: focused on family planning and counseling services into a comprehensive health care provider and some free medical services.

column1: == Shopping ==
There are three major shopping centers in West Covina: Plaza West Covina
column3: and The Heights at West Covina.

column1: === Plaza West Covina ===
Plaza West Covina is a regional mall that has 208 shops
column3: and restaurants. The mall is two levels and is anchored by Macy's (180
column11: and the XXI Forever flagship store
column12: also to the north. There is a food court on the second level as well as other restaurants
column13: and food and drink kiosks throughout the mall. The mall is known for its many fashion shops and high-end fashion boutiques.

column1: === Eastland Center ===
The Eastland Center is a power center which has undergone major renovations since it opened in 1957. Eastland is two levels
column2: with parking for the lower level on south side of the center and parking for the upper level on the north side. It has many larger department stores like Burlington Coat Factory
column5: and PetSmart. Eastland Center is anchored by Walmart to the west and by Target   (122

column4: and Target to the south. The center has many stores and restaurants.

== Transportation ==
Foothill Transit
column3: provides services across San Gabriel Valley with buses going to Downtown Los Angeles and Montclair. In addition to the bus services provided by Foothill Transit
column4: the Los Angeles Metropolitan Transportation Agency
column6: provides services from El Monte Station to Cal Poly Pomona.

column1: The city operates the Go West shuttle bus system
column2: with three routes that provide transportation to several West Covina destinations. The city also provides a free shuttle bus to the Baldwin Park Metrolink station.

column1: == In popular culture ==

West Covina and the San Gabriel Valley are the setting for and featured prominently in the US television series Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. It is erroneously depicted as being part of the Inland Empire and being "two hours from the beach
column2: four in traffic."In the 1999 movie Blue Streak
column3: Martin Lawrence's character says he was transferred from that city as a front for getting in the department.

column1: The 1997 Nickelodeon film Good Burger was mostly filmed in West Covina.
West Covina is mentioned in The Mountain Goats song “The Grey King and the Silver Flame Attunement”.
In a 2017 X-Men comic Iceman and Kitty Pryde rescue a young mutant named Zach from a West Covina shopping center.
